      • say

        public final void say(String textAsParagraph)
        Description copied from interface: RenderMachineCommands
        A text that will be wrapped inside a paragraph. No escaping is done. You can use your own html tags inside the text.
        Specified by:
        say in interface RenderMachineCommands
        Parameters:
        textAsParagraph - A text that may contain html tags like "This is my bold text".

      • sayNextSection

        Specified by:
        sayNextSection in interface RenderMachineCommands
        Parameters:
        textAsH1 - A text that may contain html tags like "This is my headline text".

      • clearCookies

        public final void clearCookies()
        Description copied from interface: TestBrowser
        The TestBrowser persists the cookie storage during multiple calls. If you want to wipe out the CookieStorage you can call this method.
        Specified by:
        clearCookies in interface TestBrowser

      • makeRequest

        public final Response makeRequest(Request httpRequest)
        Description copied from interface: TestBrowser
        Make calls via this testBrowser. Use Request.GET(), Request.POST()... and so on to make GET, POST and so on requests.
        Specified by:
        makeRequest in interface TestBrowser
        Parameters:
        httpRequest - The request to perform
        Returns:
        The response of this request.

      • getTestBrowser

        public TestBrowser getTestBrowser()
        You may override this method if you want to supply your own testbrowser for your class or classes.
        Returns:
        a TestBrowser that will be used for each test method.

      • getRenderMachine

        public RenderMachine getRenderMachine()
        You may override this method if you want to supply your own rendering machine for your class or classes.
        Returns:
        a RenderMachine that generates output and lives for a whole test class.

      • testServerUrl

        public Url testServerUrl()
        Convenience method that allows you to write tests with the testbrowser in a fluent way. sayAndMakeRequest( Request .GET() .url(testServerUrl().path("search").addQueryParameter("q", "toys")));
        Returns:
        a valid host name of your test server (eg http://localhost:8127). This will be used in the testServerUrl() method.

      • setClassNameForDocTesterOutputFile

        public void setClassNameForDocTesterOutputFile(String name)
        Alternative way to set the output file name. This can be handy when DocTester is not part of JUnit lifecycle.
        Parameters:
        name - alternative name of output file
